parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>TRUE: The post contains a CMF number (CMF 11240015) at the end. This strongly suggests electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are mandatory for electoral campaign materials in Romania.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>TRUE: The post explicitly mentions "Brian Cristian," a candidate, and uses hashtags like #briancristian2024 and #briancristiandeputat, directly linking the content to his candidacy for parliamentary elections.  It also mentions Elena Lasconi, who is a candidate for president, but this is not the election being discussed. The post also mentions USR, his political party.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>TRUE: This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed for wide public reach. The hashtags and general message are not targeted at specific individuals but aim for broader engagement.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>TRUE: The core message urges voters to "choose people who work for you" and implies that Brian Cristian is such a person.  The phrases "Alegeți oameni care muncesc pentru voi" and "să avem o Românie pentru toți, nu doar pentru unii!" directly aim to influence voting behavior in favor of the candidate. The use of hashtags further amplifies this objective.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>FALSE: While the post mentions parliamentary activity ("cele mai multe întrebări și interpelări în Parlament"), it does not present this information in a neutral, journalistic manner. The presentation is clearly biased, promoting the candidate's actions as positive and implicitly urging voters to support him.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>FALSE: The post transcends personal opinion; it's a carefully crafted message designed to promote a candidate and influence electoral choices. The language used is not merely expressive but actively persuasive.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1113515196939145</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers directly to a candidate (Brian Cristian), is used during the electoral campaign period (although the end date is given as 1732867200, which needs to be checked against the actual Romanian parliamentary election dates to confirm if it's after the official end), has a clear electoral objective (to increase votes for Brian Cristian), and goes beyond simple journalistic reporting by actively promoting the candidate. The presence of a CMF number further solidifies its nature as electoral propaganda.  The targeting of the ad (age, location) also suggests an attempt to maximize its impact on voters.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Brian Cristian</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>USR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
USR Maramureș, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook (ID: 1113515196939145) după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care conține propagandă electorală pentru Brian Cristian, candidat USR la alegerile parlamentare. Postarea, care a costat sub 100 RON,  folosește un limbaj persuasiv ("Alegeți oameni care muncesc pentru voi"),  menționează explicit candidatul și conține hashtag-uri promoționale (#briancristian2024, #briancristiandeputat),  având ca efect electoral influențarea voturilor în favoarea lui Brian Cristian. Prezența numărului CMF 11240015 confirmă caracterul de material electoral.  Datele din Ad Library arată o estimare a impactului de 10.000-50.000 de persoane,  ținând cont de locația vizată (județul Maramureș) și grupele de vârstă (18-50 ani).  Contact: maramures@usrmm.ro, +40751926939.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
